channel.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
channel.description:
Ok, I have come to a problem while making my server. I have changed all the Ip's to mine and all that good stuff, I've changed to compiler info to my version of Java. I have No-Ip, I have a source and a client. Now when I first downloaded the server and client, it would load completely, it just wouldn't let me log in. :| But now, I have no idea, I must have changed something wrong or something, but now whenever I try to run my server, the "Click Here To Play!" Cmd always says this:
connecting to update server no midi or mp3 files in folder connected to update server Downloading the Cache files please wait 100% java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open<Ntive Method> at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init><ZipFile.java:114> at java.util.zip.ZipFil.<init><ZipFile.java:75> at Update.unZipFile<Update.java:53> at Update.<init><Update.java:29> at client.method67<client.java:4164> at client.method6<client.java:8259> at Applet_Sub1.run<Applet_Sub1.java:52> at client.run<client.java:93> at java.lang.Thread.run<Thread.java:619> Some strange error occured. :(
If anyone could help me in getting my server online, or getting this Cmd fixed, I would be VERY appreciative. :)
Thanks.

item.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, so I went into McAfee and looked under the firewall protection, and I went and looked at all the ports it allowed, and I checked port 80 and I added port 43594. But, I went to see if my port 43594 was open and canyouseeme.org still can’t see my service on port 43594 I don’t know what to do. Does my windows firewall have to be turned all the way off? and what would I change the existing URL to?

Read full topic

item.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, so the downloaded firewall would be my McAfee program? should I uninstall it completely? or is there a way to disable the firewall on McAfee? Also, I’m pretty sure the website for the auto cache downloader is just bad, how would I get a URL for a good auto cache downloader? :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Thank you so much. This has cleared everything up in a short and to the point format. Ok, check me if I’m wrong, but I BELIVE I have portforwarded correctly, and I have made the Port 43594 excpetion on my windows firewall. So, question. How do I check the code for the auto cache downloader?

Read full topic

item.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Thanks, that cleared one of my problems. I put in the right Ip. but canyouseeme.org still says that it cannot see me. help?

Read full topic

item.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Well, I have fooled around with my firewall forever! Honestly, its got me a little frustrated lol. But, I have made the port 43594 exception on my firewall. I have Windows 7 so it was quite an adventure lol. but I don’t know if I port forwarded correctly, I have a NETGEAR router and I went to “port forwarding/port triggering” and I set the beginning and endin ports as “43594” and the ip, Idk which one to use, do I use the IPv4 address? or do I use the Ipchicken.com ip?? I’m sorry for all the questions, but this is my first attempt at making a server. But, by the standings of “canyouseeme.org” It says: "Error: I cannot see your service on ..***.** on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out.

So, I don’t know where to begin on my problems.

Read full topic

or mabey firewall? or router?

item.title: My "Click Here To Play!" Cmd
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, I have come to a problem while making my server. I have changed all the Ip’s to mine and all that good stuff, I’ve changed to compiler info to my version of Java. I have No-Ip, I have a source and a client. Now when I first downloaded the server and client, it would load completely, it just wouldn’t let me log in. But now, I have no idea, I must have changed something wrong or something, but now whenever I try to run my server, the “Click Here To Play!” Cmd always says this:

connecting to update server
no midi or mp3 files in folder
connected to update server
Downloading the Cache files please wait
100%
java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file
at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open

at java.util.zip.ZipFil.ZipFile.java:75
at Update.unZipFileUpdate.java:53
at Update.Update.java:29

at client.runclient.java:93

Some strange error occured.

If anyone could help me in getting my server online, or getting this Cmd fixed, I would be VERY appreciative.

Thanks.
